WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: It would be nice if there was a way to have the compiler remove uncalled methods from the generated output… Maybe using an @nosideeffects annotation similar to what Googles Closure Compiler uses…

Comments.Message: Note that I think there are separate issues here for "removing uncalled functions" and "removing calls to functions marked as @nosideeffects where the return value is not used".  The first of these is something that depends on a whole-world assumption, which TypeScript generally does not make.  The second is something that is primarily a feature of a minifier, which TypeScript currently doesn't have built-in.
